meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Don Gwinn Tarn Allen Arthur Chu Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6765.

td.p: Don Gwinn, a middle school special education teacher from Virden, Illinois
Tarn Allen, a food bank coordinator from Portland, Oregon
Arthur Chu, a compliance analyst and voiceover artist from Broadview Heights, Ohio (whose 3-day cash winnings total $82,800)

tr.td: AFTER THE WHITE HOUSE
(Alex: Talking about presidents, obviously.)
DOUBLE S, DOUBLED
A MONTH OF ANNUAL EVENTS
SHAKESPEAREAN SPELLING BEE
(Alex: And you must spell the big word in the response.)
I HAVE THE WINE
BY JOHNNY CASH

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In 1965 LBJ invited this former president to witness the signing of the Medicare Act in Missouri')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In 1965 LBJ invited this former president to witness the signing of the Medicare Act in Missouri

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'We\'re playing backyard football & I\'m going to rush the passer! One this state, two this state...')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: We're playing backyard football & I'm going to rush the passer! One this state, two this state...

toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', 'National Rub a Bald Head Week,

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_4_1', 'clue_J_4_1_stuck', '(Don: What are the Montagues?)
(Alex: You got to spell it, Don.)
(Don: I\'m sorry. M-O--what is [*]?)
(Alex: You got it.)
(Don: BY JOHNNY CASH for $200, please.)
(Alex: Got away from the spelling pretty fast.)
[Laughter]

M-O-N-T-A-G-U-E

Don
')

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):

tr.td: Arthur
Tarn
Don

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Arthur
Tarn
Don
PLANTS & TREES
EPONYMOUS AIRPORTS
IN THE NATIONAL PARK
(Alex: You tell us which national park.)
CANADIAN BODIES OF WATER
A "CY" OF RELIEF
(Ben Mankiewicz: I'm Ben Mankiewicz with clues about some of the classic films you'll see starting tomorrow on...)

Kraków

ArthurTarn
Triple Stumper
')

appears to have been
brought back from the dead with a few drops of water, so it's called this plant, a term for the rising of Christ

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Arthur
Tarn
Don

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Don] ...who was demonstrating his safety brake for elevators. That\'s the correct response.)
...
(Alex: On Monday, we start our Battle of the Decades with the winners from the 1980s. Arthur will be back in three weeks.)
DonWho was Otis?
$7,200
TarnWho is Eli Whitney?
$12,000
ArthurWho was Nobel?
$8,000
Elisha Otis')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In an 1854 demonstration, he said, "Cut the rope"; his invention kicked in, then he said, "All safe, gentlemen"')

tr.td: INVENTORS
In an 1854 demonstration, he said, "Cut the rope"; his invention kicked in, then he said, "All safe, gentlemen"
Arthur
Tarn
Don
4-day champion: $102,800
3rd place: $1,000
2nd place: $2,000
Arthur
Tarn
Don

24 R
(including 1 DD),
1 W

20 R
(including 2 DDs),
2 W

body.div: The J! Archive is created by fans, for fans. The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
